metadata.title: CVE-2022-0812 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An information leak flaw was found in NFS over RDMA in thenet/sunrpc/xprtrdma/rpc_rdma.c in the Linux Kernel. This flaw allows anattacker with normal user privileges to leak kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
